msContents.summary: Letter by Barnabas known as Epistle of Barnabus written 71-131 in Alexandria, Aegyptus

objectDesc.p: Parchment, 43x38, 411 extant leaf(s), 4 column(s), 48 line(s) per column, 11-16 characters per line, written in Greek.

additions.p: Also contains Septuagint, Apocrypha, and Shepherd of Hermas.

history.provenance: Donated 548-560 to Ieras Monēs Theobadistou Orous Sina, Agias Aikaterinēs (Holy Monastery of St. Catherine at Mount Sinai) at Dayr al Qiddīsah Kātrīnā, Miṣr by Emperor Jusinian.
Discovered 1761 by Vitaliano Donati at Dayr al Qiddīsah Kātrīnā, Miṣr.

[1,3,5-18,410-411] Discovered 1975 by Ieras Monēs Theobadistou Orous Sina, Agias Aikaterinēs (Holy Monastery of St. Catherine at Mount Sinai) at Dayr al Qiddīsah Kātrīnā, Miṣr in a room beneath the St. George Chapel during restoration work.
[2a,4] Transferred 1845 Jan-Jun to Konstantin Uspenski (Bishop Porphyrius) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[2a,4] Transferred 1883 to Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[2b] Discovered 1853 by Konstantin Tischendorf at Dayr al Qiddīsah Kātrīnā, Miṣr as it was being used as a bookmarker in another book.
[2b] Transferred 1858 to Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[19,39-50,52-111,136-409b] Transferred 1859 Feb 24 to Metochi tēs Ieras Monēs Theobadistou, Agias Aikaterinēs (Metochin of Holy Monastery of St. Catherine) at Al Qāhirah, Miṣr.
[19,39-50,52-111,136-409b] Donated 1859 Sep 16 to Konstantin Tischendorf at Leipzig, Deutschland.
[19,39-50,52-111,136-409b] Transferred 1862 to Ministerstvo Inostrannykh Del (Ministry of Forein Affairs) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[19,39-50,52-111,136-409b] Transferred 1869 Nov to Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[19,39-50,52-111,136-409b] Purchased 1933 by British Museum at London, England.
[19,39-50,52-111,136-409b] Moved 1973 to British Library at London, England.
[20-38,112-135] Transferred 1845 to Konstantin Tischendorf at Leipzig, Deutschland.
[20-38,112-135] Transferred 1845 to Universitätsbibliothek Leipzig (Leipzig University Library) at Leipzig, Deutschland.
[51] Purchased by antiquities dealer (Shibanov?).
[51] Transferred pre 1899 to Obshchestvo Liubiteleĭ Drevneĭ Pisʹmennosti (Society of Lovers of Ancient Literature) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[51] Transferred 1932 to Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[409a] Transferred to Konstantin Uspenski (Bishop Porphyrius) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[409a] Transferred 1883 to RNB. F. п. I. 83, Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija as part of Porfiry Collection.
[409a] Relabelled as RNB. Gr. 843, Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia) at Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.

msIdentifier.msName: [1,3,5-18,410-411] MG 1, Ieras Monēs Theobadistou Orous Sina, Agias Aikaterinēs (Holy Monastery of St. Catherine at Mount Sinai), Dayr al Qiddīsah Kātrīnā, Miṣr.
[2a,4] RNB. Gr. 259, Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia), Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[2b] RNB. Gr. 2, Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia), Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[19,39-50,52-111,136-409b] Add. MS 43725, British Library, London, England.
[20-38,112-135] MS gr. 1, Universitätsbibliothek Leipzig (Leipzig University Library), Leipzig, Deutschland.
[51] RNB. OLDP. O. 156, Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia), Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.
[409a] RNB. Gr. 843, Rossiĭskaia Natsionalʹnaia Bibloteka (National Library of Russia), Sankt-Peterburg, Rossija.

sourceDesc.bibl: Tischendorf, Constantinus, Bibliorum Codex Sinaiticus Petropolitanus, Petropoli: Lipsiae, Deutschland, 1862. OCLC 1475638.
